data.name: Moon Defence
data.detailed_description:
It's a single-player shooter featuring old-school steady style, destructible buildings, stubborn enemies and twilight landscapes of biggest moons of Solar System planets.


Your turret is a remade crane. Your weaponry - hastily redesigned plasmatron, laboratory laser and experimental energy absorber. Your opponents are awaken Wardens.
Energy is strictly limited, plasma reload in the lull only, surviving is a real victory. In this dangerous journey you step from one moon to another with an uncertain outcome. Stand still and shoot straight all the enemies. Control a replenishable energy budget, pump your weapon, research artifacts. And perhaps you shouldn’t destroy a monoliths.

Key Features

  • Extremely simple game mechanic
  • Tactical variety
  • Unique landscapes of biggest moons across Solar System
  • Ability to create a defensive infrastructure and customizable turret armament
  • Bonus levels on every planet system

Plot


Year 2061. Weaponry rusts in museums. Earthlings have forgotten the wars as they master the Solar System. Science labs and industrial bases are posted wherever a human feet can step.



Once the communication with farther settlements has lost. The colonies evaporate one by one. From the ripped reports it becomes clear that unknown agressors cruelly eradicate all of the colonists. Nobody can perceive the motivation of attackers.

Since the metropolis is too far, it can't help fast enough. Settlers must construct weapon of everything they have. Plasmagenerators, mining lasers were welded on the excavator cabin, it was mounted on the turret and reliably buried in the ground close to base.



The remainings of earthlings on Pluto, Saturn, Mars, Moon and other are resourceful and fearless. Desperate defense turns into encouraging struggle. It’s time to choose your way to protect, banish or collapse.

data.short_description: Aiming is uneasy, movements are slow, resources are hard to earn. Stop farming infinite vegetables, try to acquire some more jigowatts in empty space, where no one can hear your scream. Moon is a harsh mistress.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 7 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel i3 or AMD equivalent
  • Memory: 6 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon R7 M265
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX compatible
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: WIndows 10 64-bit
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060 or AMD equivalent
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Sound Card: DirectX compatible

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
